		<item>
			<title>FBI Chief: Battle Over Encrypted Devices Rages On</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/government/fbi-chief-battle-over-encrypted-devices-rages-on/d/d-id/1325503?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url> 	http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325503/iPhonePasscode_Mutlu-Kurtbas_iStock_000021873834_Large.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Dawn Kawamoto]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/dawn-kawamoto.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Despite dropping its fight with Apple over creating a backdoor to access the iPhone used by one of the San Bernardino shooters, the FBI still plans to pursue access to other encrypted devices and data, said the agency's director.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:36:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/government/fbi-chief-battle-over-encrypted-devices-rages-on/d/d-id/1325503</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Google 'Chirp' Aims To Silence Amazon Echo, Report Says</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/iot/google-chirp-aims-to-silence-amazon-echo-report-says/a/d-id/1325500?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325500/Google.2.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Zeman]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Zeman_IWK_125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Google is preparing a competitor to Amazon's Echo, reportedly called "Chirp," which will put voice-activated Google search into a device that's similar to Google's OnHub WiFi hotspot.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/iot/google-chirp-aims-to-silence-amazon-echo-report-says/a/d-id/1325500</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Salesforce Outage: Can Customers Trust The Cloud?</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/platform-as-a-service/salesforce-outage-can-customers-trust-the-cloud/d/d-id/1325499?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325499/screenshot-of-salesforce-status.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Jessica Davis]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Jessica_Davis.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Salesforce experienced an outage and service disruption to the NA14 instance, sending customers to Twitter to complain and organizations to evaluate the best way to work with cloud software providers.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/platform-as-a-service/salesforce-outage-can-customers-trust-the-cloud/d/d-id/1325499</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Opera Claims Power-Saving Mode Improves Battery Life</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/infrastructure/pc-and-servers/opera-claims-power-saving-mode-improves-battery-life/d/d-id/1325498?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325498/opera-powersaver-baner1.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Nathan Eddy]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Nathan_Eddy.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Opera has made some under-the-hood enhancements to its Web browser to help extend laptop battery life. Other new features focus on security, privacy, and efficiency.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/infrastructure/pc-and-servers/opera-claims-power-saving-mode-improves-battery-life/d/d-id/1325498</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Microsoft Azure Expands Into Canada, South Korea</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/infrastructure-as-a-service/microsoft-azure-expands-into-canada-south-korea/d/d-id/1325488?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325488/iStock_000063388587_Large.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Charles Babcock]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Charles_Babcock%20125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Microsoft is investing $15 billion to establish the Azure Cloud as a worldwide presence. Canada and South Korea are part of its expansion roadmap.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/infrastructure-as-a-service/microsoft-azure-expands-into-canada-south-korea/d/d-id/1325488</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Facebook Open/R: From Bridging Gaps To Network App Dev</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/facebook-open-r-from-bridging-gaps-to-network-app-dev/d/d-id/1325463?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325463/facebook_1588595368104928_498031687_n.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Charles Babcock]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Charles_Babcock%20125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[In the process of developing Terragraph, a network aimed to bring wireless Internet access to dense urban environments, Facebook has made strides in network application development. Here's why its Open/R platform -- slated to be offered to the open source community -- could eventually influence enterprise network development as we know it. ]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 09:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/facebook-open-r-from-bridging-gaps-to-network-app-dev/d/d-id/1325463</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Microsoft Is Shuttering Sunrise Calendar App</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/software/productivity-collaboration-apps/microsoft-is-shuttering-sunrise-calendar-app/d/d-id/1325484?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325484/sunrise_sunset.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kelly Sheridan]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Sheridan-IWK-125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Microsoft plans to sunset Sunrise, the calendar app it acquired in 2015, later this summer. The Sunrise team will now work on the company's mobile Outlook app.
]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 08:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/software/productivity-collaboration-apps/microsoft-is-shuttering-sunrise-calendar-app/d/d-id/1325484</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>8 Non-Tech Skills IT Pros Need To Succeed </title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/it-life/8-non-tech-skills-it-pros-need-to-succeed-/d/d-id/1325476?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325476/softskills_intro.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kelly Sheridan]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Sheridan-IWK-125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Communication and active listening don't normally come to mind when thinking of top skills for IT pros, but these "soft skills" can make a tremendous difference in building a successful career. ]]></description>
			<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 07:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/it-life/8-non-tech-skills-it-pros-need-to-succeed-/d/d-id/1325476</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Microsoft Kills Controversial Windows 10 Wi-Fi Sense</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/software/operating-systems/microsoft-kills-controversial-windows-10-wi-fi-sense/d/d-id/1325480?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/04/1325289/Windows10_Michal-Krakowiak_iStock_000077815893_Medium.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Dawn Kawamoto]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/dawn-kawamoto.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[In its latest Windows 10 build, Microsoft disables its Wi-Fi Sense feature, which allows users to easily share their networks with friends -- and, inadvertently, hackers.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/software/operating-systems/microsoft-kills-controversial-windows-10-wi-fi-sense/d/d-id/1325480</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Amazon Alexa Now Tracks Flights, Plans Trips </title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/iot/amazon-alexa-now-tracks-flights-plans-trips-/a/d-id/1325477?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/03/1324660/AmazonEchoAlexa.PNG</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Zeman]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Zeman_IWK_125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[The Kayak travel search engine is now accessible on Amazon's Alexa to let users search for and track flights.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 12:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/iot/amazon-alexa-now-tracks-flights-plans-trips-/a/d-id/1325477</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Pebble Smartwatch Updates Include Expanded Health, Fitness Features</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-devices/pebble-smartwatch-updates-include-expanded-health-fitness-features/d/d-id/1325467?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325467/pebble.1.5.11.16.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Nathan Eddy]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Nathan_Eddy.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Pebble's smartwatch has been updated with new capabilities to help users better track their fitness performance. It also now includes Smart Alarms to ease the pain of waking up.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 11:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-devices/pebble-smartwatch-updates-include-expanded-health-fitness-features/d/d-id/1325467</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>How Bimodal IT Can Kill Your Company</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/strategic-cio/digital-business/how-bimodal-it-can-kill-your-company/a/d-id/1325457?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325457/bimodal_IT.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Curtis Franklin Jr.]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.lightreading.com/enterpriseefficiency/CurtisFranklin_125x125.gif</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Is bimodal IT the way to get innovation and stability right in the enterprise? Or will kill your company? John McCarthy of Forrester says it's far more likely to do the latter than the former. ]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 10:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/strategic-cio/digital-business/how-bimodal-it-can-kill-your-company/a/d-id/1325457</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Nvidia Car Learns To Drive By Watching Humans</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-devices/nvidia-car-learns-to-drive-by-watching-humans/d/d-id/1325460?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325460/nvidia2.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Thomas Claburn]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Tom_Claburn%20125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[With a convolutional neural network, Nvidia researchers have trained a car to drive using video captured during road trips taken by people.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 09:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-devices/nvidia-car-learns-to-drive-by-watching-humans/d/d-id/1325460</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>What Large Storage Vendors Aren't Telling You About OpenStack And Software-Defined Storage</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/partner-perspectives/redhat/what-large-storage-vendors-arent-telling-you-about-openstack-and-software-defined-storage/a/d-id/1325473?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel Gilfix]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/daniel-gilfix.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Simple, low-cost commodity storage devices can be used just as effectively, if not more so, than traditional proprietary, high-cost options.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 08:34:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/partner-perspectives/redhat/what-large-storage-vendors-arent-telling-you-about-openstack-and-software-defined-storage/a/d-id/1325473</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Docker Security Scanning Protects Container Software Stack</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/infrastructure-as-a-service/docker-security-scanning-protects-container-software-stack/d/d-id/1325451?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325451/iStock_000010252257_Small.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Charles Babcock]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Charles_Babcock%20125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Docker addresses vulnerabilities that can creep into the container's software stack with its just released Security Scanning offering.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 08:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/cloud/infrastructure-as-a-service/docker-security-scanning-protects-container-software-stack/d/d-id/1325451</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>Top 10 Highest Paying Tech Companies</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/strategic-cio/team-building-and-staffing/top-10-highest-paying-tech-companies/d/d-id/1325449?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325449/Slide1_Intro.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Dawn Kawamoto]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/dawn-kawamoto.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Looking to work for a tech company that offers a lucrative salary? Here's a cheat sheet based on Glassdoor's list of the highest paying US tech companies in 2016. ]]></description>
			<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 07:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/strategic-cio/team-building-and-staffing/top-10-highest-paying-tech-companies/d/d-id/1325449</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>IBM Watson To Fight Cybercrime </title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/big-data/ibm-watson-to-fight-cybercrime-/d/d-id/1325462?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325462/IBM_DKart_iStock_000060541864_Medium.png</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Dawn Kawamoto]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/dawn-kawamoto.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[After Watson beat human players on the TV game show Jeopardy!, its cognitive might was put to work in a variety of fields, including healthcare and finance. Now IBM Security is dispatching the supercomputer to fight cybercrime. ]]></description>
			<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 15:36:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/big-data/ibm-watson-to-fight-cybercrime-/d/d-id/1325462</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>PC Sales Topple To 2011 Levels, Tablets Continue Decline</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/infrastructure/pc-and-servers/pc-sales-topple-to-2011-levels-tablets-continue-decline/d/d-id/1325459?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325459/iStock_000053496370_Small(1).jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Kelly Sheridan]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Sheridan-IWK-125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[The global PC market had a rough first quarter as demand continued to fall. Hybrid devices took the lead as tablets fell farther behind, according to market research firm Canalys.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 14:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/infrastructure/pc-and-servers/pc-sales-topple-to-2011-levels-tablets-continue-decline/d/d-id/1325459</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>iPhone 7 Rumor Wars Confuse Apple Watchers</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/iphone-7-rumor-wars-confuse-apple-watchers/a/d-id/1325458?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2015/12/1323427/applestore_beijing2-2.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Eric Zeman]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Zeman_IWK_125x125.jpg</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[Constantly changing rumors demonstrate no one knows anything certain about the iPhone 7 -- but we can catch the latest round of speculation.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 13:06:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/iphone-7-rumor-wars-confuse-apple-watchers/a/d-id/1325458</guid>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title>FCC, FTC Probe Carriers' Mobile Security Patch Protocols</title> 
				<link>http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-applications/fcc-ftc-probe-carriers-mobile-security-patch-protocols/d/d-id/1325456?_mc=RSS_IWK_EDT</link> 
							<image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/2016/05/1325456/iStock_000020613846_Small.jpg</url></image>
						
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Nathan Eddy]]></dc:creator>	
			
			<dc:image><url>http://img.deusm.com/informationweek/Nathan_Eddy.png</url></dc:image>
			
			<description><![CDATA[The FCC and the FTC want to know how mobile carriers, such as Verizon Wireless, T-Mobile, and AT&T, are responding to mobile threats and protecting consumers with security patches.]]></description>
			<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 12:05:00 EDT</pubDate>
			<guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.informationweek.com/mobile/mobile-applications/fcc-ftc-probe-carriers-mobile-security-patch-protocols/d/d-id/1325456</guid>
		</item>
	</channel>
